text: [Music]
I'm Hilda clone and I'm the CIO of PwC
PwC is a global network of firms who
deliver professional services to clients
technology has changed significantly not
just in the way we deliver it but in the
way that it's consumed it's now become
not just an essential enabler but an
essential part of the business strategy
in terms of growth where cloud has been
a differentiator for us is in its
ability to support affordable
experimentation one of the great
benefits that we've seen is the ability
to scale when you need to shrink when
you need to and basically have full
control of your capacity and your
workloads and so that in itself is a
great enabler to experimentation the
ability to fail fast the ability to
scale to the degree that you need to for
a period of time that suits depending on
whatever project you're working on and
that flexibility gives us a platform
that changes the business case around
how we experiment moving forward we
started our journey with Amazon as we
were looking to solve for a problem
where we no longer wanted to run our own
data center being a professional
services firm and being in the business
that we are safety and confidentiality
of data relating to our clients is front
of mind our exploration with AWS was
very much about how we could use the AWS
platform but still maintaining guarantee
our commitment to our clients we see
cloud and AWS more specifically as a way
of supporting a product development
cycle in getting technology products
into the market working with AWS has
been hugely beneficial for us in
upscaling
our existing team but also attracting
new members of our team
who have really embraced the skill set
required to make the most of the AWS
platform the biggest thing I've learned
from moving to the cloud is the true
transformation that's happened behind
the scenes it's all about easily being
able to address resilience stability
agility in a move that was necessary but
turned out to be one of the biggest
transformations we've done for me
running hardware is not was not critical
to my business when there are other
people in the market who are much better
positioned to do that
on my behalf cloud has been really
pivotal to allowing us to offer
technologies to our people and clients
that perhaps would not be possible in
other forms impact on experimentation is
actually the ability to do it in an
affordable way that has been the biggest
enabler for us so in the past we would
have had to source Hardware provision
hardware support it and once you have
done that you have committed to a
long-term investment in cloud it's the
ability to tap into a pool of resource
that is available to you on demand
moving from a capex to a knoppix morale
with a you know an agile cost lever has
given us lots of different ways to think
about how we can be more cost effective
over time the biggest surprise moving to
cloud for me has been the incredible
silence and the stability that the
platform is really provided if I could
go back to day one I would accelerate
our move to the cloud AWS is helping us
think very differently about what's
possible where cloud only
[Applause]
